definition: white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known
to hold up a white banner (i.e. to protest)

sentences.english: You cannot draw white cloth from a dying vat.
She dunked a piece of white cloth in the dye.
sentences.chinese: 她把一块白布浸入染料中。

sentences.english: It is only a screen, often made from calico.
sentences.chinese: 只有一个荧幕，多半是用白布做的。

sentences.english: Saying so, he unveils the sheet of calico from the corpse.
sentences.chinese: 他一边说着一边撤下了那块盖在尸体上的白布。

sentences.english: She bought a piece of white cloth powdered with red spots.
sentences.chinese: 她买了一块上有红点的白布。

sentences.english: Her mother asks her to buy two chi of unbleached cloth.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈让她买两尺本白布回家。

sentences.english: There is no damage of each angle but the surface of the trunk.
sentences.chinese: 衬白布底，边角无破损但箱面下塌。

sentences.english: The protestors tied strips of white cloth around their heads to "mourn the death of the rule of law".
sentences.chinese: 示威者头上系着白布，哀悼法治之死。

sentences.english: Men wear straw hats in summer or simply tie a piece of white cloth around their foreheads.
sentences.chinese: 男人在夏天戴草帽或者简单的在前额上戴一条白布。

sentences.english: My company's bleached cotton cloth has been occupied Beijing market share of 70 percent.
sentences.chinese: 我公司的纯棉漂白布已经占有北京市场70%的份额。

sentences.english: In the first place, it will be a white cloth.
